title: Read/Write arbitrary (non-HttpOnly) cookies on checkout pages via GoogleAnalyticsAdditionalScripts postMessage handler

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

activities.message: I realized this report is a tad light on end to end proof of concepts compared to my other reports since I focused on the technical details. Let me know if you'd like me to add full proof of concepts for any of the described issues (ideally with an example domain that has sensitive cookies).

Thanks for your report, @bored-engineer. We're still looking into this and will follow up with you next week.

Have a good weekend.

Hey @bored-engineer 
just letting you know we haven't lost sight of this. Sorry it's taken us so long to follow up.

Hi @bored-engineer 
Thank you for your report. Can you please provide a concrete proof of concept for registering an additional tracker on the checkout page?

Sorry for the delay @saba_kia, added some rough PoCs:
Write Cookie: https://attackerdoma.in/0c11366d-0b9a-4283-af3b-47d63a30d811.html
Read Cookie: https://attackerdoma.in/9ccc038e-e34c-4f15-8c48-34d25a84a68b.html
JS on checkout.shopify.com: https://attackerdoma.in/3c66816b-e1cc-4a6c-895f-c0b13e1093a8.html

Howdy @bored-engineer,

Wanted to let you know this is still on our radar.

Sorry for the delay. You can expect to hear back from us early next week.
@zack_spotify No worries, have a great weekend!
Thank you for your report! We were able to reproduce the issue and our engineering team is working on a fix. We will get back to you as soon as we come to a decision on bounty eligibility.

Hi @bored-engineer,
Thanks again for your report! 
We’re awarding a $1600 bounty for this issue. Please find below our rationale generated using our [CVSS calculator](https://shopify.github.io/appsec/cvss_calculator/).

## Base Score CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N 4.2
## Environment: Core

#### Attack Complexity: H
* Specific conditions or measurable effort to exploit?: Yes

#### Privileges Required: N
* Requires privileged account (not self-registered)?: No

#### User Interaction: R
* Requires victim to perform some action during exploit?: Yes

#### Scope: U
* Can the attacker impact a separate service?: No

#### Confidentiality: L
* How much data could be accessed?: Some
* How much of Shopify is impacted?: Some

#### Integrity: L
* How much data could be changed?: Some
* How much of Shopify is impacted?: Some

#### Availability: N
* Level of disruption to network service?: None

Hi @bored-engineer.

Thanks again for your report. Our engineering team has deployed a fix for this so the issue should no longer be reproducible. If you are able to bypass the fix, please let us know.

Thanks for helping make Shopify more secure. We hope you'll continue to do so.

Happy Hacking!
